hook.text: A class exposes all its internal variables. Any other code can change them without warning.

buildup.text: Encapsulation hides internal state and exposes only what's necessary through a controlled interface.

discovery.text: When internals are hidden, you can change how a class works without affecting anything that uses it.

twist.text: Java's getter/setter pattern often fakes encapsulation. Exposing every field defeats the purpose.

climax.text: True encapsulation means asking an object to do something, not reaching inside to do it yourself.

punchline.text: Hide the details. Expose the intent.
